intro: Centaurea ucriae subsp. todaroi, commonly known as the Todaro's cornflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers and spiny bracts, which are typical of the genus Centaurea. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and wastelands. It has a compact growth habit with upright stems and is well adapted to arid conditions. The subspecies is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and subtle morphological differences from other members of the species.
